headline.main: Army Chaplain Wins Prize to Give 9/11 Sermon by Ground Zero
headline.print_headline: Army Chaplain Wins Prize to Give 9/11 Sermon by Ground Zero

docs.snippet: An Army chaplain has won a national prize for an original sermon that he will deliver on Sept. 11 at a chapel near ground zero that became a sanctuary of consolation after the terrorist attacks....
docs.lead_paragraph: An Army chaplain has won a national prize for an original sermon that he will deliver on Sept. 11 at a chapel near ground zero that became a sanctuary of consolation after the terrorist attacks.

headline.main: Police: Boy Who Died May Have Been in Hot Vehicle 3 Hours
headline.print_headline: Police: Boy Who Died May Have Been in Hot Vehicle 3 Hours

docs.snippet: A 4-year-old boy who died in a stifling hot pickup truck in a Las Vegas home driveway might have been in the vehicle for up to three hours after his grandfather returned home with him on a sunny 100-degree day, authorities said Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A 4-year-old boy who died in a stifling hot pickup truck in a Las Vegas home driveway might have been in the vehicle for up to three hours after his grandfather returned home with him on a sunny 100-degree day, authorities said Friday.

headline.main: Bush praises resilience of New Orleans schools on Katrina anniversary
headline.sub: Bush praises resilience of New Orleans schools on Katrina anniversary

docs.snippet: Former President George W. Bush speaks at Warren Easton Charter School in New Orleans on the tenth anniversary of Hurricane Katrina. Rough Cut (no reporter narration)....
docs.lead_paragraph: Former President George W. Bush speaks at Warren Easton Charter School in New Orleans on the tenth anniversary of Hurricane Katrina. Rough Cut (no reporter narration).

headline.main: Court Ruling on NSA Data Collection Shows Program Is Constitutional: White House
headline.print_headline: Court Ruling on NSA Data Collection Shows Program Is Constitutional: White House

docs.snippet: The U.S. appellate court decision on the National Security Agency's collection of phone metadata was consistent with the Obama administration's stance that the intelligence gathering programs are constitutional, the White House said on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. appellate court decision on the National Security Agency's collection of phone metadata was consistent with the Obama administration's stance that the intelligence gathering programs are constitutional, the White House said on Friday.

headline.main: Republican Rubio Attacks China's Xi Ahead of Visit
headline.print_headline: Republican Rubio Attacks China's Xi Ahead of Visit

docs.snippet: Republican presidential candidate Marco Rubio on Friday accused Chinese President Xi Jinping, who is scheduled to make a state visit to Washington next month, of stepping up a campaign to push the United States out of Asia....
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential candidate Marco Rubio on Friday accused Chinese President Xi Jinping, who is scheduled to make a state visit to Washington next month, of stepping up a campaign to push the United States out of Asia.

headline.main: Europe Should Crack Down on Traffickers Exploiting Migrants: White House
headline.print_headline: Europe Should Crack Down on Traffickers Exploiting Migrants: White House

docs.snippet: The White House said on Friday that the migrant crisis in Europe shows that unrest in the Middle East has impacts far beyond the region....
docs.lead_paragraph: The White House said on Friday that the migrant crisis in Europe shows that unrest in the Middle East has impacts far beyond the region.

docs.snippet: As thousands risk their lives to reach Europe this summer, Jacob Greaves looks at what migrants offer European economies....

headline.main: Book Review Podcast: ‘Give Us the Ballot’

docs.snippet: On this week’s podcast, Ari Berman talks about “Give Us the Ballot”; Simon Winchester discusses Susan Barker’s “The Incarnations”; and Parul Sehgal has best-seller news....
docs.abstract: On this week’s podcast, Ari Berman talks about “Give Us the Ballot”; Simon Winchester discusses Susan Barker’s “The Incarnations”; and Parul Sehgal has best-seller news.

headline.main: Exhausted Migrants Scuffle at Greek-Macedonian Border
headline.print_headline: Exhausted Migrants Scuffle at Greek-Macedonian Border

docs.snippet: Scuffles and limited fights broke out Friday among more than 1,000 people at Greece's northern border with Macedonia as exhausted, thirsty migrants jostled to get into position to cross....
docs.lead_paragraph: Scuffles and limited fights broke out Friday among more than 1,000 people at Greece's northern border with Macedonia as exhausted, thirsty migrants jostled to get into position to cross.
